question_text: Currently, do you allow personal devices in your classroom to be used by students for educational purposes on a daily basis?
How important is the integration of technology to your everyday teaching practices? (e.g., showing a YouTube video as an example, Google Classroom, Kahoot, etc.)
Does your school have a phone policy?
Under your school’s phone policy, when are students allowed to use their phones at school? Select all that apply.
How does your school currently restrict access to phones?
Overall, how satisfied are you with your school's phone policy?
How consistently do teachers and staff enforce your school's phone policy? Give your best guess.
What percentage of your students are using their phone when they shouldn’t be? Give your best guess.
In your opinion, should your school's phone policy be more or less restrictive than it is now?
What challenges have you faced with implementing and/or enforcing the phone policy?
Do you have any suggestions for overcoming those barriers?
Please rate the extent to which you agree that the following statements apply to your students.  A significant number of my students…
Seem interested in school
Maintain positive and respectful relationships with each other
Seem to care about grades
Have good attendance
Participate in class discussions/activities
Need external disciplinary policies to behave
Are respectful to staff
Persist when tasks are challenging
Demonstrate appropriate effort for task
Are self-motivated
Please rate the extent to which the following statements apply to your relationship with your students in general.
I share warm relationships with my students.
My students and I always seem to be struggling with each other.
Dealing with my students drains my energy.
My students' feelings toward me can be unpredictable or can change suddenly.
My interactions with my students make me feel effective and confident.
My students seem to feel secure with me.
Please indicate how often these behaviors occur from a significant number of your students.
Have difficulty staying on task
Yell or scream
Are easily distracted
Fail to finish tasks or projects
Act defiant when told to do something
Please read each statement and mark the response that best shows how much you agree. In this school…
Adults who work in this school care about the students.
Teachers care about their students.
Students are friendly with each other.
Students care about each other.
Teachers show respect towards parents.
Teachers listen to the concerns of parents.
Students feel safe.
The school rules are fair.
This school makes it clear how students are expected to act.
Students know how they are expected to act.
Please indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with the following statements about your experience as a teacher at this school.
I am satisfied with my co-workers’ competence.
I am satisfied with the behavior among my students.
I am satisfied with my parent interactions at my school.
I feel supported by my school’s  administration with respect to our phone policy.
I enjoy teaching.
I get frustrated during my time teaching in the classroom.
Teaching often drains my energy.
Please rate the extent to which you agree with the following statements about your relationships with the administration at your school.
I feel supported by the administration at my school.
I get along well with the administration at my school.
I feel connected to the administration at my school.
The following statements are about your overall experiences with the parents of your students. Please read each item and rate the degree to which you agree or disagree with the statement.
In general, I feel comfortable talking with my students' parents.
In general, my students' parents feel comfortable talking with me.
In general, I enjoy talking with my students' parents.
In general, I have confidence in my students' parents.
In general, parents think I am doing good things for their children.
Please rate your level of agreement with the following statements about your stress at school. I feel stressed for…
not having support from the administrators at my school.
not having support from colleagues at my school.
having to manage student behaviors.
having too much teaching work to do.
not having enough time to complete my teaching work (e.g., preparing, teaching the curricular content).
not being able to meet the diverse learning needs of my students.
not doing a good job with my teaching.
Please rate how often you experience the following.
I feel emotionally drained from my work.
I feel used up at the end of the workday.
I feel fatigued when I get up in the morning and have to face another day on the job.
Working with people all day is really a strain for me.
I feel burned out from my work.
I feel like I'm at the end of my rope.
Please share any other major changes at this school within the past school year that might have affected student behavior or school climate (e.g., policy changes, large student turnover, etc.).
Please share any other thoughts you have about your school's phone policy.
Is there anything else you want to share with us?
What grade level(s) do you primarily teach?
Area(s) taught: (Mark all that apply)
At what academic level do you teach the majority of your classes?
How many total years of experience do you have working in education (any role)?
What is your gender?
With which racial/ethnic groups do you identify? You can select more than one.
Overall, how would you say this new phone policy has changed your school?

Please rate your agreement with the following statements about your students’ behavior or feelings since the _____ [school to add] policy was introduced. “Since the new phone policy that was introduced in _______ [school to add] …
Students seem more focused in class.
Students seem less distracted
Students have developed better social skills.
Students have formed closer bonds with their peers.
Students are being left out or excluded more.
Students seem more anxious without their phones.
Students have talked to more people during lunch or breaks.
Students seem less pressured to check their phones.
There have been fewer discipline problems at my school.
There seems to be less social drama between students.
Academic outcomes have improved.
Class disruptions have declined.
Lack of smartphone access in class has impaired teaching.
Nothing has really changed for students.
